    • Uses of Disposable in ray.rage.asset

      Subinterfaces of Disposable in ray.rage.asset 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  Asset
      An asset is external data that is loaded by the system, such as meshes, textures, materials, etc.
      interface  AssetLoader<T extends Asset>
      An asset loader is responsible for loading the raw data of an asset directly from the file system and transforming it into a format that's meaningful to, and usable by, the framework.
      interface  AssetManager<T extends Asset>
      An asset manager is responsible for handling the assets and their life-cycle.
      Classes in ray.rage.asset that implement Disposable 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  AbstractAsset
      An abstract asset for extension by concrete implementations.
      class  AbstractAssetManager<T extends Asset>
      An abstract asset-manager for extension by concrete implementations.

      An Animation describes a sequence of frames that can be applied to a SkeletalEntity object.

      A animation manager is responsible for managing the life-cycle of animations.

      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  TextureLoader
      A texture loader is an asset-loader that can load images from the file system to be used as textures.
      Classes in ray.rage.asset.texture that implement Disposable 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Texture
      A texture is an asset that contains a buffered-image in the sRGB color-space and can be mapped to a mesh's geometry for rendering, among other things.
      class  TextureManager
      A texture manager is responsible for managing the life-cycle of textures.

    • Uses of Disposable in ray.rage.rendersystem

      Subinterfaces of Disposable in ray.rage.rendersystem 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  Renderable
      A renderable is a discrete object that can be rendered by a render-system.
      interface  RenderSystem
      A render system defines the functionality of a low-level 3D API.
      interface  RenderWindow
      A render window is what's presented as the main application widget for user interaction.
      interface  Viewport
      A viewport is a 2D rectangle that defines the size of the rendering surface onto which a 3D scene being rendered from a camera's point of view is projected.

      Classes in ray.rage.rendersystem.gl4 that implement Disposable 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      (package private) class  GL4AbstractRenderState
      A base implementation of the render-state interface for a GL4RenderSystem.
      class  GL4FrontFaceState
      A concrete implementation of the front-face-state interface for a GL4RenderSystem.
      class  GL4RenderSystem
      An OpenGL 4-specific implementation of the render-system interface, using the Java OpenGL bindings to interact with the graphics hardware.
      class  GL4RenderWindow
      A concrete implementation of the render-window interface for a GL4RenderSystem.
      class  GL4TextureState
      A concrete implementation of the texture-state interface for a GL4RenderSystem.
      class  GL4Viewport
      A concrete implementation of the viewport interface for a GL4RenderSystem.
      class  GL4ZBufferState
      A concrete implementation of the z-buffer-state interface for a GL4RenderSystem.

    • Uses of Disposable in ray.rage.rendersystem.shader

      Subinterfaces of Disposable in ray.rage.rendersystem.shader 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  GpuShaderProgram
      A GPU shader program represents the modern programmable graphics pipeline.
      static interface  GpuShaderProgram.Attribute<T>
      An input attribute.
      static interface  GpuShaderProgram.Context
      The context encapsulates all the objects whose information is needed by the program to execute properly.
      static interface  GpuShaderProgram.Input<T>
      An input expected by the program from clients.
      static interface  GpuShaderProgram.LocatableInput<T>
      A nameable input in the source code that is given a location ID at runtime by the underlying driver.
      static interface  GpuShaderProgram.StorageBuffer<T>
      A dynamic storage buffer for input data that receives a buffer ID at runtime by the underlying driver.
      static interface  GpuShaderProgram.Uniform<T>
      An input uniform.

      A buffer of integer values, as expected by a GLSL shader program.

      Concrete implementation of a shader-program to process a sky-box.

    • Uses of Disposable in ray.rage.rendersystem.states

      Subinterfaces of Disposable in ray.rage.rendersystem.states 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  FrontFaceState
      A front-face state determines which side, or "face", of a primitive should be drawn.
      interface  RenderState
      A render state has information about settings that should be applied to the underlying graphics driver in use by the render-system implementation.
      interface  TextureState
      A texture state determines which textures will be used, how they'll be applied, filtered, stored in GPU memory, and other properties.
      interface  ZBufferState
      A z-buffer state has information about settings related to depth testing.

    • Uses of Disposable in ray.rage.scene

      Subinterfaces of Disposable in ray.rage.scene 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  AmbientLight
      An ambient light provides global, and evenly-distributed, illumination for an entire scene.
      interface  Camera
      A camera is viewpoint from which the scene will be rendered.
      interface  Entity
      An entity defines a discrete scene-object based on a mesh.
      interface  Light
      A light is a scene-object that can illuminate other scene-objects in a scene.
      interface  ManualObject
      A manual object defines a discrete scene-object whose geometric data must be directly specified by the client.
      interface  ManualObjectSection
      A manual object section is a renderable part of a manual-object.
      static interface  Node.Controller
      A controller handles nodes make it easier to apply behaviors by concrete implementations.
      interface  SceneManager
      A scene manager handles the creation, organization, and rendering of a scene, i.e., a collection of objects and potentially world geometry.
      interface  SceneObject
      A scene object is an object that can be placed in a scene by getting attached to a scene-node.
      interface  SkeletalEntity
      A Skeletal Entity extends the notion of an Entity to add support for Skeletal animations using a skeleton, and a mesh.
      interface  SkyBox
      A sky box is a textured cube that simulates the presence of a sky, ground, and horizon in a scene.
      interface  SubEntity
      A sub entity is a renderable part of an entity, much like the independent pieces of a jigsaw puzzle forms a whole picture.
      interface  Tessellation
      A tessellation is a textured plane that is primarily used to simulate terrain in a scene.
      interface  TessellationBody
      A tessellation body is the renderable part of a tessellation.
